body: @zone1511  all concrete  DB plugin project dependency `jdbc-commons` project, just move the test cases about concrete `URLParser` to concrete plugin project
@ascrutae there are some test cases in `jdbc-common` which required URLParser.parser for mysql url. Do you want to move all those `SW*` test cases to mysql plugin?

The test case under the `jdbc-common` are tested for another way to enhance jdbc plugin.  So you cannot remove the test cases.
Maybe you can try to  using mock `statement` instead of  the mysql `statement`.

@zone1511 @ascrutae If intend to move `UrlParser` into each plugins, then there is no need to provide a `parser` load mechanism, because there is only one. So either use a `***Parser#parse` method in plugin, or read parse implements for `jdbc-common`

Glad you find your own answers. Need any help, let me know.
@ascrutae Do you merge the test cases before plugin merged. There are all 4 kafka cases fail.

I think this is a ***BIG*** move switch es client from high-api client (use 9300 port) to http rest client (use 9200 via http) which can support ssl / TLS and x-pack or search-guard or nginx basic-auth.

btw , elastic plan **deprecat**  high-api client in the future.

i think we can use okhttp as es client like zipkin.

Give me some time to read the code about skywalking's es client.

Yes, it is **BIG**. But it depends on which one is better. Let's list something.
* `x-pack` is commercial related, so, many open source users can't use it. 
* SSL or nginx-auth is for security reason, right? But do that worth about adding security features in ES connection. 
* `elastic plan deprecat high-api client in the future`. This is important, where can we confirm that information? and which library does the ElasticSearch recommend officially?

Can you give me a demo for reproduce this issue? 

Still I have one question about this issue, Does the demo works without Skywalking agent? because I found that the method cannot found in the class `T4CPreparedStatement` but the Druid framework use the `unwrap` method  to execute some stuff.

hi,guys,how does this issue going?I wonder how to support this feature?what's the solution to support this batch merge traceid feature?If I want to get traceid from log,so I have log all the traceids to log? so maybe the log of the batch job is all traceids.

找到问题了，需要再开放一下9300端口，要不然会一直连接。

___
Tranlate by @wu-sheng

Solved. Port 9300 need open too.
This issue is about UI and query only. In log, you should focus on log application tool kits we provided already.

> We plan on deprecating the TransportClient in Elasticsearch 7.0 and removing it completely in 8.0. Instead, you should be using the Java High Level REST Client, which executes HTTP requests rather than serialized Java requests. The migration guide describes all the steps needed to migrate.

Change the client from java to rest is necessary. The rest api is exactly similar to the java api. And from this notice, I didn't see any reason about performance, and the version 7.0 to be deprecating, 8.0 removed, that maybe one year later. So I think we can't do it in a short time or you can help us to do it on 5.0 version. This version will release next month.

> When you initially install X-Pack, a 30 day license is generated that allows access to X-Pack features.
 
I don't think provide the x-pack is necessary. To be a stand alone plugin project maybe better.

> 1. Support 'variables', using Gson to parse the 'variables' node of post payload to a java.util.Map object.

I provide getAllApplication and getApplicationTopology methods only, is there any scenes that need to use 'variables'? I will do it when that other methods need.

> 9200 is for REST.
> 9300 for nodes communication.

Collector use java client with TransportClient, so must set 9300 for the address port.

Coverage remained the same at 21.669% when pulling **a5e37108afc2ad8cfcf5fd79ac2f38ca070891d6 on ascrutae:feature/spring-bean-plugin** into **8c859d1ce880cbf65bd46e8eaaf1adb1d1a1cd7f on apache:master**.

## Producer Span
1. Operation name :  **Kafka/{TopicName}/Producer** , eg. Kafka/test/Producer
2. tags:
```
   mq.broker: '127.0.0.1:9092'
   mq.topic: test
```
3. Spanlayer: MQ
4. ComponentName: KAFKA

## Consumer Span
1. Operation name :  **Kafka/{TopicName}/Consumer** , eg. Kafka/test/Consumer
2. tags:
```
   mq.broker: '127.0.0.1:9092'
   mq.topic: test
```
3. Spanlayer: MQ
4. ComponentName: KAFKA

I found an issue in your demo
the annotation in `ExceptionInterceptorAspect` class
`@Pointcut("execution(* com.candao.dms2.gps.controller..*(..)) and 
@annotation(org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping)")`

should be like this:
`@Pointcut("execution(* com.candao.dms2.gps.controller..*(..)) && @annotation(org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping)")`

I found some question about this PR, here are the questions:

Q1:  I use the [demo](https://github.com/lytscu/skywalking-agent-testcases/tree/servicecomb/servicecomb-0.x-scenario) to trace the service about Servicecomb, I found the trace is broken,  The **consumer** trace segment should be like the following:
```
Span-0: codefirstClient.codeFirstSpringmvcHello.say
Span-1: codefirst.codeFirstHello.sayHi
```
but in fact those spans are in two segments.

Q2: The buried point `Invocation`  is more complex, I found some buried point about Servicecomb  plugin will more simple. 
**Consumer side**:
1. `io.servicecomb.common.rest.RestProducerInvocation#createInvocation` 
2. `io.servicecomb.common.rest.AbstractRestInvocation#invoke`

The `Pojo` way about Servicecomb
1. `io.servicecomb.provider.pojo.Invoker#invoke`

**Producer Side**:
1. `io.servicecomb.swagger.engine.SwaggerProducerOperation#invoke`
@ascrutae @lytscu Why does the trace brake? Because of multi thread situation? or header propagation?
@ascrutae I don't think these can be caused by where you set the interceptor.

@ascrutae I can't follow you with the spans expected:
> Span-0: codefirstClient.codeFirstSpringmvcHello.say
Span-1: codefirst.codeFirstHello.sayHi

What does this mean? What is now? and brake how?

@zone1511 I think that will be hard, because of following reasons:
1. JVM/server metrics are only related to VM, Sorry.
1. Application topology map based on this application, instead of VM-level application, will make people hard to understand, and more complex. Also, we are facing to move Docker based arch, right? It is not popular to deploy more than one application in a container, even not popular in Cloud or VM based env.
1. This requirement ask a change to our core, in order to allow two application context existed.
1. We need to rename application to config + `/webroot`, causes more config for end users.

So, in technical way, it is possible. But I would say easy.

Do you think it is worth to do so?

@wu-sheng Sorry for my poor english, and here is my explain.

I use the demo to enhance ServicceComb and found that the trace is broken. 
Here is the expected segment about demo:
```
 ServiceComb-Segment:
    Span-0: `codefirstClient.codeFirstSpringmvcHello.say`
    Span-1: `codefirst.codeFirstHello.sayHi`
```

In fact the generated segment looks like this:

```
SerivceComb-Segment-0:
   Span-0: `codefirstClient.codeFirstSpringmvcHello.say`

ServiceComb-Segment-1:
  Span-0: `codefirst.codeFirstHello.sayHi`
```
    
The question is cause by the buired point is incorrect. Because of the enhance method `next` finished before the service method invoke.

I found some suggest enhance class about `REST` service. But the ServiceComb support multiple way to provide service, maybe @lytscu still find the similar enhance class. 

**Consumer side**
`io.servicecomb.common.rest.RestProducerInvocation#invoke`: The entry method about REST way to provide service.
`io.servicecomb.provider.pojo.Invoker#invoke`: The entry method about ServiceComb RPC client stub .(The demo in call ServiceComb service by PRC)

**Producer side**
`io.servicecomb.core.handler.impl.ProducerOperationHandler#handle`: The entry method about RPC service stub.

@ascrutae That explain makes sense. 

@lytscu please pay attentiom. about you intercept point, make sure they are in the main request thread, such as http incoming request thread. same in server side.  And make sure header can propagate in the right way.

> I provide getAllApplication and getApplicationTopology methods only, is there any scenes that need to use 'variables'? I will do it when that other methods need.

I use variables for all arguments. So I send a commit to enhance `GraphQLHandler` to parse variables

One challenge I can think of is how to identify two figure comes from two application. For j2ee. Class loader is a good way to identify but if the class is loaded from parent class loader then it is complicated. Anyway. Just brain storm the possibility.

@peng-yongsheng Just some typos fix. Merging it.

> One challenge I can think of is how to identify two figure comes from two application. For j2ee. Class loader is a good way to identify but if the class is loaded from parent class loader then it is complicated. Anyway. Just brain storm the possibility.

I think you didn't need this complex way to identify the web application. You can use the web-root detection to find out the application's web root path. Then, when you have a transaction, you can know the application based the url prefix.

The #783 issue caused by The GRPC modified the code writing in 1.8, it caused the burial point to go wrong. The GRPC plugin currently uses the Interceptor mechanism provided by GRPC to intercept service calls
